means: 挑选( choose的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: He chooses to look into the matter till the truth is out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他决定调查那件事直至真相大白.

sentence.Network_en: Each week Dr Buczacki chooses a listener's question and gives a detailed answer.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个星期布柴齐医生都会选取一位听众的问题，给予详细回答。

PerfectNetExp.abs: He is always very selective when he chooses his suits ., 他在选购套装时总是细心挑.
Each chooses its gift and its patron ., 每个种族选择他们的天赋和守护神.
be sure to appoint over you the king the LORD your God chooses .你总要立耶和华你神所拣选的人为王。
be sure to appoint over you the king the LORD your God chooses .你总要立耶和华你神所拣选的人为王。

list.abs: lost because I choose to be a single drop of Guhun ., 因为失落 , 我选择做一个落单的孤魂.
What do you like?你喜欢什么? ... Let’s grab a bite. 我们去吃点东西吧. You choose. 你选择. You decide. 你决定.
上海大众卓越一线执行--用户注册 ... 部门: Department 请选择 Please choose 男 male.
中考英... ... 一封给友人的信( a letter to a friend) 选择朋友( choosing friends) 我对考试的意见( My Views on Examinations).

entry.def: If you choose someone or something from several people or things that are available, you decide which person or thing you want to have.

example.ex: They will be able to choose their own leaders in democratic elections...
example.tran: 他们将能够通过民主选举选择自己的领导人。

example.ex: This week he has chosen Peter Mandelson to replace Mo Mowlam...
example.tran: 本周他选择了彼得·曼德尔森来代替莫·摩兰姆。

entry.def: If you choose to do something, you do it because you want to or because you feel that it is right.

example.ex: They knew that discrimination was going on, but chose to ignore it...
example.tran: 他们当时知道歧视现象仍然存在，但是宁愿装聋作哑。

example.ex: You can just take out the interest each year, if you choose.
example.tran: 你要是愿意，每年可以仅支取利息。

entry.def: If there is little to choose between people or things or nothing to choose between them, it is difficult to decide which is better or more suitable.

example.ex: There is very little to choose between the world's top tennis players.
example.tran: 世界顶级网球运动员之间往往难分伯仲。

entry.tran: 享受优厚待遇的少数人；精英
entry.def: The chosen few are a small group who are treated better than other people. You sometimes use this expression when you think this is unfair.

example.ex: Learning should no longer be an elitist pastime for the chosen few.
example.tran: 学习不应再是少数人的高级消遣。

auth_sentence.content: Solo traveller Sandberg chooses small hotels run by locals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Solo traveller Sandberg chooses small hotels run by locals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Solo traveller Sandberg chooses small hotels run by locals.

auth_sentence.content: I asked Maxime how she chooses what to order.
auth_sentence.res_content: I asked Maxime how she chooses what to order.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I asked Maxime how she chooses what to order.

auth_sentence.content: Early admission to Oberlin, but he chooses Columbia.
auth_sentence.res_content: Early admission to Oberlin, but he chooses Columbia.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Early admission to Oberlin, but he chooses Columbia.

Sentence.sentence: The city is the building block of civilisation and of almost everything people do; a guidebook to the city is really, therefore, a guidebook to how a large and ever-growing chunk of humanity chooses to live.
